channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: BitsFusion: 1.99 bits Weight Quantization of Diffusion Model
item.description: Diffusion-based image generation models have achieved great success in recent years by showing the capability of synthesizing high-quality content.

item.title: Batch-in-Batch: a new adversarial training framework for initial perturbation and sample selection
item.description: Adversarial training methods commonly generate independent initial perturbation for adversarial samples from a simple uniform distribution, and obtain the training batch for the classifier without selection.

item.title: DSNet: A Novel Way to Use Atrous Convolutions in Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Following these guidelines, we propose DSNet, a Dual-Branch CNN architecture, which incorporates atrous convolutions in the shallow layers of the model architecture, as well as pretraining the nearly entire encoder on ImageNet to achieve better performance.

item.title: LLMEmbed: Rethinking Lightweight LLM's Genuine Function in Text Classification
item.description: With the booming of Large Language Models (LLMs), prompt-learning has become a promising method mainly researched in various research areas.

item.title: Do Language Models Understand Morality? Towards a Robust Detection of Moral Content
item.description: We introduce the Davinci model as a state-of-the-art zero-shot unsupervised moral values classifier, pushing the boundaries of moral value detection without the need for explicit training on labeled data.

item.title: Jailbreak Vision Language Models via Bi-Modal Adversarial Prompt
item.description: To address this limitation, this paper introduces the Bi-Modal Adversarial Prompt Attack (BAP), which executes jailbreaks by optimizing textual and visual prompts cohesively.

item.title: Spatio-temporal Early Prediction based on Multi-objective Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Accuracy and timeliness are indeed often conflicting goals in prediction tasks.

item.title: ReST-MCTS*: LLM Self-Training via Process Reward Guided Tree Search
item.description: We first show that the tree-search policy in ReST-MCTS* achieves higher accuracy compared with prior LLM reasoning baselines such as Best-of-N and Tree-of-Thought, within the same search budget.

item.title: VideoTetris: Towards Compositional Text-to-Video Generation
item.description: Diffusion models have demonstrated great success in text-to-video (T2V) generation.

item.title: VISTA: Visualized Text Embedding For Universal Multi-Modal Retrieval
item.description: Thirdly, we introduce a multi-stage training algorithm, which first aligns the visual token embedding with the text encoder using massive weakly labeled data, and then develops multi-modal representation capability using the generated composed image-text data.

item.title: Uncovering Limitations of Large Language Models in Information Seeking from Tables
item.description: Seeking information from tables (TIS) is a crucial capability for Large Language Models (LLMs), serving as the foundation of knowledge-based Q&A systems.

item.title: AgentGym: Evolving Large Language Model-based Agents across Diverse Environments
item.description: Building generalist agents that can handle diverse tasks and evolve themselves across different environments is a long-term goal in the AI community.

item.title: Chaos with Keywords: Exposing Large Language Models Sycophancy to Misleading Keywords and Evaluating Defense Strategies
item.description: This study explores the sycophantic tendencies of Large Language Models (LLMs), where these models tend to provide answers that match what users want to hear, even if they are not entirely correct.

item.title: Reassessing How to Compare and Improve the Calibration of Machine Learning Models
item.description: A machine learning model is calibrated if its predicted probability for an outcome matches the observed frequency for that outcome conditional on the model prediction.

item.title: Compressible Dynamics in Deep Overparameterized Low-Rank Learning & Adaptation
item.description: In practice, we demonstrate the effectiveness of this approach for deep low-rank matrix completion as well as fine-tuning language models.

item.title: Semantically Diverse Language Generation for Uncertainty Estimation in Language Models
item.description: Current LLMs generate text in an autoregressive fashion by predicting and appending text tokens.

item.title: JIGMARK: A Black-Box Approach for Enhancing Image Watermarks against Diffusion Model Edits
item.description: In this study, we investigate the vulnerability of image watermarks to diffusion-model-based image editing, a challenge exacerbated by the computational cost of accessing gradient information and the closed-source nature of many diffusion models.

item.title: Shadow and Light: Digitally Reconstructed Radiographs for Disease Classification
item.description: Additionally, CheXnet trained on the CheXpert dataset can accurately identify several pathologies, even when operating out of distribution.

item.title: Optimal Batched Linear Bandits
item.description: We introduce the E$^4$ algorithm for the batched linear bandit problem, incorporating an Explore-Estimate-Eliminate-Exploit framework.

item.title: Measuring and Addressing Indexical Bias in Information Retrieval
item.description: Information Retrieval (IR) systems are designed to deliver relevant content, but traditional systems may not optimize rankings for fairness, neutrality, or the balance of ideas.

item.title: Offline Multi-Objective Optimization
item.description: Offline optimization aims to maximize a black-box objective function with a static dataset and has wide applications.

item.title: Vectorized Conditional Neural Fields: A Framework for Solving Time-dependent Parametric Partial Differential Equations
item.description: Transformer models are increasingly used for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs).

item.title: M3LEO: A Multi-Modal, Multi-Label Earth Observation Dataset Integrating Interferometric SAR and RGB Data
item.description: Satellite-based remote sensing has revolutionised the way we address global challenges in a rapidly evolving world.

item.title: C^2RV: Cross-Regional and Cross-View Learning for Sparse-View CBCT Reconstruction
item.description: Cone beam computed tomography (CBCT) is an important imaging technology widely used in medical scenarios, such as diagnosis and preoperative planning.

item.title: Adaptive Multi-Scale Decomposition Framework for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Transformer-based and MLP-based methods have emerged as leading approaches in time series forecasting (TSF).

item.title: Evaluating the World Model Implicit in a Generative Model
item.description: Building generative models that meaningfully capture the underlying logic of the domains they model would be immensely valuable; our results suggest new ways to assess how close a given model is to that goal.

item.title: Low-Rank Similarity Mining for Multimodal Dataset Distillation
item.description: Though dataset distillation has witnessed rapid development in recent years, the distillation of multimodal data, e. g., image-text pairs, poses unique and under-explored challenges.

item.title: Spherinator and HiPSter: Representation Learning for Unbiased Knowledge Discovery from Simulations
item.description: We present a prototype using a rotational invariant hyperspherical variational convolutional autoencoder, utilizing a power distribution in the latent space, and trained on galaxies from IllustrisTNG simulation.

item.title: PaCE: Parsimonious Concept Engineering for Large Language Models
item.description: Alignment methods are designed to reduce such undesirable output, via techniques such as fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and representation engineering.

item.title: ReNO: Enhancing One-step Text-to-Image Models through Reward-based Noise Optimization
item.description: Moreover, given the same computational resources, a ReNO-optimized one-step model outperforms widely-used open-source models such as SDXL and PixArt-$\alpha$, highlighting the efficiency and effectiveness of ReNO in enhancing T2I model performance at inference time.

item.title: BLSP-Emo: Towards Empathetic Large Speech-Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we present BLSP-Emo (Bootstrapped Language-Speech Pretraining with Emotion support), a novel approach to developing an end-to-end speech-language model capable of understanding both semantics and emotions in speech and generate empathetic responses.

item.title: HackAtari: Atari Learning Environments for Robust and Continual Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Overall, HackAtari can be used to improve the robustness of current and future RL algorithms, allowing Neuro-Symbolic RL, curriculum RL, causal RL, as well as LLM-driven RL.

item.title: Lean Workbook: A large-scale Lean problem set formalized from natural language math problems
item.description: Our results indicate that the synthetic data pipeline can provide useful training data and improve the performance of LLMs in translating and understanding complex mathematical problems and proofs.

item.title: LNQ Challenge 2023: Learning Mediastinal Lymph Node Segmentation with a Probabilistic Lymph Node Atlas
item.description: The evaluation of lymph node metastases plays a crucial role in achieving precise cancer staging, influencing subsequent decisions regarding treatment options.

item.title: HeSum: a Novel Dataset for Abstractive Text Summarization in Hebrew
item.description: While large language models (LLMs) excel in various natural language tasks in English, their performance in lower-resourced languages like Hebrew, especially for generative tasks such as abstractive summarization, remains unclear.

item.title: Stereo-Depth Fusion through Virtual Pattern Projection
item.description: This paper presents a novel general-purpose stereo and depth data fusion paradigm that mimics the active stereo principle by replacing the unreliable physical pattern projector with a depth sensor.

item.title: From Tissue Plane to Organ World: A Benchmark Dataset for Multimodal Biomedical Image Registration using Deep Co-Attention Networks
item.description: To gain the most information from this multimodal, multiscale approach, it is desirable to identify precisely where a histologic tissue section was taken from within the organ in order to correlate with the tissue features in exactly the same organ region.

item.title: Bench2Drive: Towards Multi-Ability Benchmarking of Closed-Loop End-To-End Autonomous Driving
item.description: In an era marked by the rapid scaling of foundation models, autonomous driving technologies are approaching a transformative threshold where end-to-end autonomous driving (E2E-AD) emerges due to its potential of scaling up in the data-driven manner.

item.title: The 3D-PC: a benchmark for visual perspective taking in humans and machines
item.description: It is an essential feature of human intelligence, which develops over the first decade of life and requires an ability to process the 3D structure of visual scenes.

item.title: On the Expressive Power of Spectral Invariant Graph Neural Networks
item.description: On the other hand, we prove that EPNN itself is bounded by a recently proposed class of Subgraph GNNs, implying that all these spectral invariant architectures are strictly less expressive than 3-WL.

item.title: Leveraging automatic strategy discovery to teach people how to select better projects
item.description: We develop a computational method (MGPS) that automatically discovers project selection strategies that are optimized for real people and develop an intelligent tutor that teaches the discovered strategies.

item.title: The CLRS-Text Algorithmic Reasoning Language Benchmark
item.description: Three years ago, a similar issue was identified and rectified in the field of neural algorithmic reasoning, with the advent of the CLRS benchmark.

item.title: Pointer-Guided Pre-Training: Infusing Large Language Models with Paragraph-Level Contextual Awareness
item.description: We introduce "pointer-guided segment ordering" (SO), a novel pre-training technique aimed at enhancing the contextual understanding of paragraph-level text representations in large language models.

item.title: ABEX: Data Augmentation for Low-Resource NLU via Expanding Abstract Descriptions
item.description: We present ABEX, a novel and effective generative data augmentation methodology for low-resource Natural Language Understanding (NLU) tasks.

item.title: Class-Aware Cartilage Segmentation for Autonomous US-CT Registration in Robotic Intercostal Ultrasound Imaging
item.description: Then, a dense skeleton graph-based non-rigid registration is presented to map the intercostal scanning path from a generic template to individual patients.

item.title: GLACE: Global Local Accelerated Coordinate Encoding
item.description: We propose GLACE, which integrates pre-trained global and local encodings and enables SCR to scale to large scenes with only a single small-sized network.

item.title: Coarse-To-Fine Tensor Trains for Compact Visual Representations
item.description: This has prevented practitioners from deploying the full potential of tensor networks for visual data.

item.title: Frequency-based Matcher for Long-tailed Semantic Segmentation
item.description: The successful application of semantic segmentation technology in the real world has been among the most exciting achievements in the computer vision community over the past decade.

item.title: Amortized Equation Discovery in Hybrid Dynamical Systems
item.description: Hybrid dynamical systems are prevalent in science and engineering to express complex systems with continuous and discrete states.

item.title: How Far Can We Compress Instant-NGP-Based NeRF?
item.description: In this paper, we introduce the Context-based NeRF Compression (CNC) framework, which leverages highly efficient context models to provide a storage-friendly NeRF representation.
